results.title: Identification of a woman = Identificazione di una donna
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Lynn Kamern, Gaumont-British Instructional and IterFilm
results.brief_description: Niccolo (Thomas Milan) needs a female for his next film project, but his ideas for both project and protagonist are somewhat vague. As his relationship with his girlfriend dissolves - she leaves him to move in with another woman, - he embarks on an affair with a young actress, but she, too, eventually eludes him. Perhaps Antonioni’s most beautiful film, this is not only the story of Niccolo’s search for his ideal woman, it is the search for his own identity which drives this film to its poignant conclusion. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Good morning Babylon
results.creator_credit: Paolo Taviani, Vittorio Taviani, Giuliani De Negri, Films A2, Filmtre, MK2 Productions, Pressman Film Corporation and RA11
results.brief_description: The Taviani Brothers’ first English language film is a bitter-sweet and joyous celebration of the early days of Hollywood movie making. Based on a true story, the film is a piece of pure and thrilling cinema and features an acclaimed performance by Charles Dance as the legendary director D.W. Griffith. Two Tuscan stonemason brothers decide to leave Italy for the New World when their father’s firm becomes bankrupt. They travel to Hollywood and wangle their way onto the film set of Griffith. They fall in love and celebrate a double wedding, however war soon intervenes to threaten their happiness.

results.title: Thoroughly modern Millie
results.creator_credit: George Roy Hill, Ross Hunter, Ross Hunter Productions and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: The Roaring Twenties come to life in this Academy Award winning musical starring Julie Andrews as the naive Millie, a country girl who comes to the big city in search of a husband. She befriends the sweet Miss Dorothy played by Mary Tyler Moore, fends off white slaver Mrs. Meers (Beatrice Lillie) and meets up with Muzzy played by Carol Channing who manages to solve all of Millie’s romantic problems which involve her boss (John Gavin) and paperclip salesman James Fox.

results.title: The Secret adventures of Tom Thumb
results.creator_credit: Bolexbrothers, Colin Rose, Hengemeth Panahi, Richard Hutchinson and Thierry Garrel
results.brief_description: This post-industrial version of the famous fariytale is given a Kafkaesque feel. Employing pixillation techniques which combine human, model and plasticine forms, the directors create a unique visual style. Leading a bleak existence in a nightmare city, a poor childless couple is suddenly and bloodily blessed with a tiny boy. their joy is short-lived for the Ministry of Sinistry agents kidnap Tom and whisk him off to the laboratory of a thousand terrors, a centre of terrifying and sadistic experiments. In this netherworld of pain, Tom finds himself among bizarre creatures, part fur, feather, bane and flesh. To escape is fraught with danger, but to stay is fatal. Technically flawless in the evocation of its grim and apocalyptic world, this film fuses its many influences, from the Quay Brothers and Svankmajer, to the short films of Starewicz, into a superbly integrated and coherent vision of evil and innocence. WARNING: Not suitable for children as some scenes may disturb some viewers.

results.title: Wicked city (D)
results.creator_credit: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Kenji Karada, Makoto Sedani and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: The treaty between humans and demons which has existed for centuries is due for renewal. The treaty is needed to prevent the world from plunging into chaos and destruction. Terrorists from both sides use the opportunity to sabotage the agreement so that they may reign supreme.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yoshiaki Kawajiri, Kenji Karada, Makoto Sedani and Manga Entertainment

results.title: The Whipping boy
results.creator_credit: Syd Macartney, Ellen Freyer and Gemini Films
results.brief_description: Based on the Newberry Award winning novella by Sid Fleichman, ‘The Whipping boy’ tells the story of spoiled Prince Horace and Jemmy a streetwise orpan who is `conscripted’ into becoming the Prince’s whipping boy; a stand-in for the the Prince when he is to be punished. When the Prince’s pranks, designed to get his father’s attention, bring the country to the brink of war, he and Jemmy escape into the wide world and a series of adventures destined to change their lives.

results.title: Hamburger hill
results.creator_credit: John irvin, Jim Carabatos, Marcia Nasatir, Interaccess, Nasitir-Carabatsos and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Set during the Vietnamese conflict in 1969, “Hamburger Hill” is a realistic, horrific dramatic depiction, almost documentary-like in format, of one of the bloodiest battles of the Vietnam War. The film follows the fortunes of 14 recruits through 10 days of hell as they make repeated assaults on a heavily fortified hill. The developing relationships between the young soldiers is tested by the grim realities of war and death. “Hamburger Hill” is a moving tribute to the men who fought a futile campaign which resulted in 70% of casualties.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John irvin, Jim Carabatos, Marcia Nasatir, Interaccess, Nasitir-Carabatsos and RKO Radio Pictures

results.title: Muriel's wedding (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: P.J. Hogan, Jocelyn Moorhouse, Lynda House, Jill Bilcock, Film Victoria, House and Moorhouse Films and Peter Szabo and Associates
results.brief_description: Muriel is a dag, an Abba maniac and out of place girl who would give anything to be like her bitchy friends. In her hunt to find Mr. Right in all the wrong places, Muriel takes a one-way ticket to freedom to find herself. A bitter-sweet and much acclaimed film which touches the essence of the themes of self-respect, identity and friendship. Toni Collette gives an inspired performance as Muriel and the supporting cast includes Bill Hunter, Sophie Lee, Jeanie Drynan and Rachel Griffiths.

results.title: Mighty Ducks 2
results.creator_credit: Sam Weisman, Jon Avnet, Jordan Kerner and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Emilio Estevez returns in another heartwarming comedy about the Mighty Ducks; an ice-hockey team full of misfit teenagers with the desire to be the best they can be. The team win an opportunity to represent their country in the Junior Goodwill Games to be held in Los Angeles. Two challenges await them - the fierce competition in the form of the team from Iceland and resisting the Hollywood glitz and glamour which threatens to tear them apart. Only team spirit will help them overcome these obstacles.

results.title: Troll in Central Park
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, Gary Goldman, John Pomeroy, Don Bluth Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Stanley is not your usual troll because he has a kind heart and a wonderful magical gift. His “green thumb” can create flowers at a touch. Wicked Queen Gnorga of the Trolls sends Stanley to New York where there is little green growing. He takes refuge in Central Park where he befriends Gus and Rosie. Unfortunately for the trio Queen Gnorga decides to spoil their fun and lets her mischief magic wreak havoc in the Big Apple. With the voices of Dom DeLuise, Cloris Leachman and Hayley Mills.
